info.title: Clowder
info.description: A cloud native data management framework to support any research domain. Clowder was developed to help researchers and scientists in data intensive domains manage raw data, complex metadata, and automatic data pipelines.

schema.title: Response Get Admin Api V2 Users Me Is Admin Get

get.description:
List all api keys that user has created

Arguments:
    skip: number of page to skip
    limit: number to limit per page

Generate an API key that confers the user's privileges.

    mins: number of minutes before expiration (0 for no expiration)

post.description: Save authorization info in Mongo. This is a triple of dataset_id/user_id/role/group_id.

get.description: Retrieve role of user for a specific dataset.

Used for testing only. Returns true if user has viewer permission on dataset, otherwise throws a 403 Forbidden HTTP exception.
See `routers/authorization.py` for more info.

Used for testing only. Returns true if user has owner permission on dataset, otherwise throws a 403 Forbidden HTTP exception.
See `routers/authorization.py` for more info.
Retrieve role of user for an individual file. Role cannot change between file versions.
Retrieve role of user for group. Group roles can be OWNER, EDITOR, or VIEWER (for regular Members).
Retrieve role of user on a particular group (i.e. whether they can change group memberships).

post.description: Assign an entire group a specific role for a dataset.
Assign a single user a specific role for a dataset.

delete.description: Remove any role the group has with a specific dataset.
Remove any role the user has with a specific dataset.

get.description: Get a list of all users and groups that have assigned roles on this dataset.

delete.description: Delete metadata definition by specific ID.

Search all metadata definition in the db based on text.

Arguments:

    skip -- number of initial records to skip (i.e. for pagination)
    limit -- restrict number of records to be returned (i.e. for pagination)

patch.description:
Update metadata. Any fields provided in the contents JSON will be added or updated in the metadata. If context or
agent should be changed, use PUT.

Returns:
    Metadata document that was updated

get.description:
Get a list of all Event Listeners in the db.

Arguments:
    skip -- number of initial records to skip (i.e. for pagination)
    limit -- restrict number of records to be returned (i.e. for pagination)
    heartbeat_interval -- number of seconds after which a listener is considered dead
    category -- filter by category has to be exact match
    label -- filter by label has to be exact match
    alive_only -- filter by alive status
    process -- filter by file or dataset type (if specified)
    dataset_id -- restrict to listeners that run on the given dataset or a file within (if not otherwise permitted)
    all -- boolean stating if we want to show all listeners irrespective of admin and admin_mode

post.description: Register a new Event Listener with the system.

get.description:
Search all Event Listeners in the db based on text.

Arguments:
    text -- any text matching name or description
    skip -- number of initial records to skip (i.e. for pagination)
    limit -- restrict number of records to be returned (i.e. for pagination)

post.description: This will take a POST with Clowder v1 extractor_info included, and convert/update to a v2 Listener.

get.description:
Get a list of all jobs from the db.
Arguments:
    listener_id -- listener id
    status -- filter by status
    user_id -- filter by user id
    file_id -- filter by file id
    dataset_id -- filter by dataset id
    created: Optional[datetime] = None,
    skip -- number of initial records to skip (i.e. for pagination)
    limit -- restrict number of records to be returned (i.e. for pagination)

get.description: Fetch all existing Feeds.

post.description: Create a new Feed (i.e. saved search) in the database.

get.description: Fetch an existing saved search Feed.

put.description:
Update the information about an existing Feed..

Arguments:
    feed_id -- UUID of the feed to be udpated
    feed_in -- JSON object including updated information

delete.description: Delete an existing saved search Feed.

post.description:
Associate an existing Event Listener with a Feed, e.g. so it will be triggered on new Feed results.

Arguments:
    feed_id: Feed that should have new Event Listener associated
    listener: JSON object with "listener_id" field and "automatic" bool field (whether to auto-trigger on new data)

delete.description:
Disassociate an Event Listener from a Feed.

Arguments:
    feed_id: UUID of search Feed that is being changed
    listener_id: UUID of Event Listener that should be disassociated

AccessList.title: AccessList
AccessList.description:
Container object for lists of user emails/group IDs/dataset IDs that can submit to listener.
The singular owner is the primary who can modify other lists.

AuthorizationBase.title: AuthorizationBase
AuthorizationBase.description:
Currently, user_ids list is used for primary authorization checks.
group_ids are kept for convenience (adding/removing users in batch) but user_ids list MUST be kept current.

AuthorizationOut.title: AuthorizationOut
AuthorizationOut.description: The creator of the Authorization object should also be the creator of the dataset itself.

ContentType.title: ContentType
ContentType.description:
This model describes the content type of any type of file(File or Visualization data) uploaded to Clowder. A typical example is "text/plain" for .txt.
In Clowder v1 extractors, "text/*" syntax is acceptable for wildcard matches. To support this, the content type is
split into main ("text") and secondary ("plain") parts so the dynamic matching with * can still be done.

EventListenerIn.title: EventListenerIn
EventListenerIn.description: On submission, minimum info for a listener is name, version and description. Clowder will use name and version to locate queue.

EventListenerJobDB.title: EventListenerJobDB
EventListenerJobDB.description: This summarizes a submission to an extractor. All messages from that extraction should include this job's ID.

EventListenerJobOut.title: EventListenerJobOut
EventListenerJobOut.description: This summarizes a submission to an extractor. All messages from that extraction should include this job's ID.

EventListenerOut.title: EventListenerOut
EventListenerOut.description: EventListeners have a name, version, author, description, and optionally properties where extractor_info will be saved.

ExtractorInfo.title: ExtractorInfo
ExtractorInfo.description: Currently for extractor_info JSON from Clowder v1 extractors for use with to /api/extractors endpoint.

FeedIn.title: FeedIn
FeedIn.description:
A Job Feed is a saved set of search criteria with some number of Event Listeners that can be triggered when new
resources match the saved search criteria for the Feed.

FeedListener.title: FeedListener
FeedListener.description:
This is a shorthand POST class for associating an existing EventListener with a Feed. The automatic flag determines
whether the Feed will automatically send new matches to the Event Listener.

MetadataAgent.title: MetadataAgent
MetadataAgent.description:
Describes the user who created a piece of metadata. If listener is provided, user refers to the user who
triggered the job.

Repository.title: Repository
Repository.description: Reference to a repository associated with Event Listener/Extractor.

RoleType.title: RoleType
RoleType.description:
A user can have one of the following roles for a specific dataset. Since we don't currently implement permissions
there is an implied hierarchy between these roles OWNER > EDITOR > UPLOADER > VIEWER. For example, if a route
requires VIEWER any of the roles can access that resource.

SearchObject.title: SearchObject
SearchObject.description:
This is a way to save a search (i.e. as a Feed).

Parameters:
    criteria -- some number of field/operator/value tuples describing the search requirements
    mode -- and/or determines whether all of the criteria must match, or any of them
    original -- if the user originally performed a string search, their original text entry is preserved here

StorageType.title: StorageType
StorageType.description:
Depending on the StorageType,the file may need different properties such as local path or URL.
Also, some StorageTypes do not support versioning or anonymous sharing.
